intro: Tibouchina nigricans, commonly known as blackbush or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking deep purple to black flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and covered in a soft, velvety texture. Tibouchina nigricans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
